resources.string: Let a, b, c ∈ Z. If a | b and b | c, then a | c.
Let a, b, c ∈ Z. If a | b and a | c, then for all x, y ∈ Z, a | (bx + cy).
Let a, b, c ∈ Z. If a | b and b ≠ 0, then |a| ≤ |b|.
If a ∈ Z and b ∈ Z, then there exist unique integers q, r such that a = qb + r where 0 ≤ r < b.
Let a, b, q, r ∈ Z. If a = qb + r, then gcd(a,b) = gcd(b,r).
Let a, b ∈ Z. If d is a positive common divisor of a and b, and ax + by = d has an integer solution, then d = gcd(a,b).
Let a, b ∈ Z. If d = gcd(a,b), then there exist x, y ∈ Z such that ax + by = d.
Let a, b, c ∈ Z. If c | ab and a, c are coprime, then c | b.
Let a, b ∈ Z, not both 0. If d = gcd(a,b), then gcd(a/d,b/ d) = 1.

Part 1:
Let a, b, c ∈ Z and d = gcd(a,b). The linear Diophantine equation ax + by = c has an integer solution if and only if d | c.
------------------------------------------------------------
Part 2:
Let a, b, c ∈ Z and d = gcd(a,b) ≠ 0. If (x0,y0) is one particular integer solution to ax + by = c, then the complete set of integer solutions is {(x0 + (b/d)n,y0 - (a/d)n) | n ∈ Z}.
There is an infinite number of primes.
Every integer greater than 1 can be uniquely expressed as a product of primes (apart from the order of the factors).
If p is a prime and p | ab, then p | a or p | b.
If x = p1a1 p2a2 … pnan is a prime power decomposition of x, then d is a positive divisor of x if and only if d = p1d1 p2d2 … pndn where di ≤ ai for each i.
If a = p1a1 ≤ pkak and b = p1b1 ≤ pkbk are prime power decompositions of a and b, then gcd(a,b) = p1d1 ≤ pkdk where di = min{ai,bi} for each i

1. a ≡ a (mod m).

 2. If a ≡ b (mod m), then b ≡ a
 (mod m).

 3. If a ≡ b (mod m) and b ≡ c
 (mod m), then a ≡ c (mod m).

1. a + b ≡ a' + b' (mod m).

 2. a - b ≡ a' - b' (mod m).

 3. a · b ≡ a' · b' (mod m).
If ac ≡ bc (mod m) and gcd(m,c) = 1, then a ≡ b (mod m).
Let a, b ∈ Z, m ∈ N. Then a ≡ b (mod m) if and only if a and b have the same remainder when divided by m.
Let a ∈ Z. If p is a prime and p ∤ a, then ap-1 ≡ 1 (mod p).

Version 1:
Let gcd(a,m) = d ≡ 1. The linear congruence ax ≡ c (mod m) has a solution if and only if d | c. Moreover, if x0 is one solution, then the complete solution is x ≡ x0 (mod m/d). Equivalently, x ≡ x0, x0 + m/d, x0 + 2m/d, … , x0 + (d - 1)m/d (mod m).
------------------------------------------------------------
Version 2:
Let gcd(a,m) = d ≡ 1. The equation [a][x] = [c] in Zm has a solution if and only if d | c. Moreover, if [x0] is one solution, then the complete solution in Zm is {[x0], [x0 + m/d], … , [x0 + (d - 1)m/d]}.

If gcd(m1,m2) = 1, then for any choice of a1, a2 ∈ Z, there exists a soultion to the simultaneous congruences: n ≡ a1 (mod m1) n ≡ a2 (mod m2) Moreover, if n0 is one solution, then the complete solution is n ≡ n0 (mod m1m2).

Let p and q be two distinct primes. If we define the following variables:

 1. n = pq and Φ(n) = (p - 1)(q - 1)
 2. e is a positive integer, 2 ≤ e < Φ(n),
 such that gcd(e,Φ(n)) = 1
 3. d is a positive integer, 2 ≤ d <
 Φ(n), such that ed ≡ 1 (mod Φ(n))
 4. M is an integer such that 0 ≤ M <
 n
 5. C is an integer, 0 ≤ C < n, such
 that C ≡ Me (mod n)
 6. R is an integer, 0 ≤ R < n, such
 that R ≡ Cd (mod n)
 
then R = M

If z and w are complex numbers, then

 1. (z + w)' = z' + w'

 2. (zw)' = z'w'

 3. (z')' = z

 4. z + z' = 2Re(z)

 5. z - z' = 2iIm(z)

If z, w ∈ C, then

 1. |z| = 0 if and only if z = 0

 2. |z'| = |z|

 3. |z|2 = zz'

 4. |zw| = |z||w|

 5. |z + w| ≤ |z| + |w|
If z1 = r1 (cos(θ1) + isin(θ1)) and z2 = r2 (cos(θ2) + isin(θ2)), then z1z2 = r1r2 (cos(θ1 + θ2) + isin(θ1 + θ2)).
For any θ ∈ R and n ∈ Z, (cos(θ) + isin(θ))n = cos(nθ) + isin(nθ).
If a = r(cos(θ) + isin(θ)), then the solutions to zn = a are\n (n√r)[cos((θ + 2kπ)/n) + isin((θ + 2kπ)/n)], k = 0, 1,…, n - 1.
If f(x), g(x) ∈ F[x] and g(x) is not the zero polynomial, then there exist unique q(x), r(x) ∈ F[x] such that f(x) = q(x)g(x) + r(x) where deg(r(x)) < deg(g(x)) or r(x) = 0.
For all complex polynomials f(x) with deg(f(x)) ≥ 1, there exists x0 ∈ C such that f(x0) = 0.
The remainder of f(x) divided by x - c is f(c).
The linear polynomial x - c is a factor of the polynomial f(x) if and only if f(c) = 0.
Let f(x) = anxn + … + a1x + a0 where a0, … , an ∈ Z, an ≠ 0. If p/q is a root of f(x) with p, q ∈ Z and gcd(p,q) = 1, then p | a0 and q | an.
Let f(x) ∈ R[x]. If c ∈ C is a root of f(x), then c\' is also a root of f(x).
